stimulusHtml: There is a point P on the graph of f at which the line tangent to the graph of f is perpendicular to the graph of g. Find the coordinates of point P.

features.html: The functions f and g are given by \(f\left(x\right)=\sqrt{x}\) and g(x) = 6 - x. Let R be the region bounded by the x-axis and the graphs of f and g, as shown in the figure above.
